how would you describe your main use cas: As a knowledge base (including technical, non-fiction and encyclopaedic content)
do you share your tiddlywiki(s) with oth: Yes, and I am the only editor/administrator of my wiki(s)
putting it all together, what value does: Tiddlywiki gives me the opportunity to design tools in a very different way from what I've done in the past. It develops my creative potential and makes me want to go further.
what is your level of ability with tiddl: I have customised TiddlyWiki through options and plugins;I am comfortable using WikiText widgets (e.g. <$transclude>, <$list>...);I am comfortable writing filter expressions;I have written custom HTML;I have written custom CSS styles
how do you save changes in tiddlywiki?: Single-file wiki with TiddlyDesktop;Single-file wiki third-party mobile app (e.g. Tiddloid, Quine)
how do you back up/sync changes between: Web or cloud hosting (other than TiddlyHost/TiddlySpot e.g. Netlify, AWS, OVH, Google Cloud...)

outside of plugins, palettes and other i: tiddlers in the sidebar, various css styles (for fonts, hr, tables, list, etc.), macros, edit the field sort order, templates for displaying different types of data, customised shortcut keys
what are we doing well? prompts for thin: I find the community open and welcoming. Experienced users spend an incredible amount of time and energy sharing the fruits of their labour and their knowledge with those who need it. The possibility of consulting several wikis together seems to me to be a very promising way forward.
what could we do better? prompts for thi: I really appreciate the fact that TW is designed to preserve data over the medium to long term. Many projects, even important ones, can become obsolete very quickly. I think TW could gain many more users by highlighting (even more than it does now) the diversity of projects that have been made possible by it.
with your consent, we would like to publ: Yes, I am happy for my responses to be published
